intro: Smilax medica var. bracteata, commonly known as the bracted smilax, is a variant of the smilax genus native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its thorny stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
